FuncDef:
The virtual-cluster-access enable command enables virtual cluster access on an interface.
The undo virtual-cluster-access enable command disables virtual cluster access on an interface.
By default, virtual cluster access is disabled on an interface.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After you run the virtual-cluster-access command to enable virtual cluster access. To enable or disable virtual cluster access on an interface, run the virtual-cluster-access enable or undo virtual-cluster-access enable command in the interface view.
Prerequisites
Virtual cluster access has been configured using the virtual-cluster-access command.
A node has been configured as a master using the role master command.
Configuration Impact
After you enable virtual cluster access on an interface, the interface automatically establishes a virtual cluster access IS-IS process. If an IS-IS process has been established on an interface before virtual cluster access is enabled, you must manually configure the process as a virtual cluster access IS-IS process.
Follow-up Procedure
Run the mpls command in the interface view to enable MPLS on the interface.
